oai_dc:dc.dc:title: REMOTE SENSING IN THE STUDY OF COASTAL PROCESSES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Magoon, Orville T.
Pirie, Douglas M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: remote sensing
coastal processes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The quantifiable determination of important coastal parameters remotely rather than by in situ measurements combined with automatic data reduction and analysis will result in a greatly increased understanding of the parameters being studied. This paper gives a progress report on joint Corps of Engineers-National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) efforts to apply remote sensing in coastal studies. The devices used were multiband photography, the infrared scanner, the Side Looking Airborne Radar and various image enhancement and processing devices.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 13 (1972): Proceedings of 13th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Vancouver, Canada, 1972.; 111
